etymology.description: Originally depicts a pair of knives used in a ritual sacrifice, showing an animal or human cut in half for Shang dynasty sacrifices.
etymology.interpretation: 卯(mǎo) was originally a term associated with sacrificial rituals involving cutting, reflecting cultural practices of the Shang dynasty. Over time, its meaning has shifted away from these origins.

examples.chinese: 这个字的卯部分揭示了它的读音(這個字的卯部分揭示了它的讀音)，构成了汉字的声音系统(構成了漢字的聲音系統)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì de mǎo bùfen jiēshì le tā de dúyīn, gòuchéng le hànzì de shēngyīn xìtǒng.
examples.english: The phonetic component of this character reveals its pronunciation, forming the sound system of Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: 研究卯的作用有助于理解汉字结构(研究卯的作用有助於理解漢字結構)。
examples.pinyin: Yánjiū mǎo de zuòyòng yǒuzhù yú lǐjiě hànzì jiégòu.
examples.english: Studying the role of the phonetic component helps to understand the structure of Chinese characters.
